name: post-radiation pulmonary changes
description: Changes to the lungs following radiation treatment, including fibrosis, consolidation, or other structural modifications

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The anatomical region of the post-radiation changes

values.name: left upper lung
values.description: Changes in the upper part of the left lung

values.name: right upper lung
values.description: Changes in the upper part of the right lung

values.name: left lower lung
values.description: Changes in the lower part of the left lung

values.name: right lower lung
values.description: Changes in the lower part of the right lung

values.name: bilateral perihilar
values.description: Changes in the perihilar or perimediastinal region of the lungs

values.name: left perihilar
values.description: Changes in the perihilar or perimediastinal region of the left lung

values.name: right perihilar
values.description: Changes in the perihilar or perimediastinal region of the right lung

values.name: apical
values.description: Changes in the apices of the lungs

attributes.name: change status
attributes.description: The status of the post-radiation changes over time

values.name: new
values.description: Changes are new and have not been previously observed

values.name: stable
values.description: Changes are stable and have not significantly changed over time; also called unchanged

values.name: evolving
values.description: Changes are evolving and show signs of progression

attributes.name: type of changes
attributes.description: The type of structural changes observed in the lung post-radiation

examples.report_text: Post radiation fibrosis noted in the anterior left upper lung.
Stable postradiation changes in the right upper lung.
Observations of stable postradiation changes in the left perihilar lung, with traces of emphysematous changes and bronchial wall thickening.
and left lower lobe likely representing postradiation changes. Unchanged scattered bilateral pulmonary nodules, for example:
Stable post radiation changes in the right upper lung, possibly due to post radiation or post inflammatory scarring.
Unchanged postradiation changes in both lungs. Right-sided pleural effusion also present.
3.  Consolidative opacities in the right upper lobe and right middle lobe, which most likely represent postradiation changes.    4.  Mild pulmonary edema with a trace right pleural effusion.

Post radiation changes are noted in the right perihilar lung.   Pleura: No pleural effusion or pneumothorax.   Mediastinum: No central pulmonary embolism.   Lymph Nodes: No enlarged supraclavicular, axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymph nodes.

likely represents a focus of postobstructive pneumonia. Post radiation change in the left upper lobe and right lower lobe is stable. There are bilateral solid and subsolid nodules measuring up to 13 mm in the subpleural left lower lobe (4:254) and
Left perihilar patchy opacity with traction bronchiectasis, representing postradiation changes.
Postradiation changes observed in the anterior right upper and middle lobe.
lung likely representing post radiation changes. Near complete resolution of numerous extensive tree-in-bud nodules throughout all lobes with few residual tree-in-bud nodules
